Erin & Dan

Chicago, IL

2016

We are thrilled to announce our wedding. Please join us on September 17th for a day of celebration, family, old friends, strong drinks, and dancing. We can't wait to see you there.

RSVP

Our wedding

4:30pm
Palmer Square Park
Palmer Street & Humboldt Boulevard

Our ceremony will be held outdoors at Palmer Square, our favorite park in Chicago.

Reception

Saturday, September 17th

6:30pm
Trigger Chicago
2810 W Addison Street

We're pumped to spend an evening with all of our favorite people eating, dancing, and sharing a few drinks. There may even be a speech or two.

RSVP

Welcome cocktail hour

Friday, September 16th

7:00pm
The Radler
2375 N. Milwaukee Avenue

We'll be hanging out on Friday night before the wedding to spend some time with friends and family before the big day. We aren't having a traditional rehearsal dinner, but still wanted to see friends and family, especially those visiting us from out of town, before the big day. If you are able, stop by and join us for drinks and appetizers. If you can't make it two days in a row, that's okay! We'll be sure to give you a hug on Saturday.

RSVP

In order to save everyone a trip to the post office, we will be collecting RSVPs electronically. We would love to know if you will be joining us by September 5th.

Info & Travel

Wedding day travel

Our ceremony and reception are in different places, but there are plenty of options for getting to and from each stop on the big day. We've put together a few options for you to take , , or !

While parking is available at all of our venues, we recommend taking public transit, car share, or bike share if you can.

Ceremony

Saturday, September 17th

4:30pm
Palmer Square Park
Palmer Street & Humboldt Boulevard

Travel to the ceremony

Public transportation:
The park is a short walk from the California blue line stop as well as the Armitage, Fullerton, and other buses.

Parking:
Free street parking can be found on Palmer, Kedzie, Humboldt, and many of the smaller neighborhood streets near the park. If you're unsure about a particular spot, be sure to watch out for permit parking signs and enforced days/times.

Car share:
If you'd rather not drive, we highly recommend taking Uber or Lyft to our ceremony and reception. If it's your first time using a car share service, sign up via the following links and we'll both get free rides! Lyft or Uber.

Bicycle:
Take Chicago's excellent Divvy bike share system to one of the stations near the park!

Reception

Saturday, September 17th

6:30pm
Trigger Chicago
2810 W Addison Street

Travel to the reception

Public transportation:
Trigger is a short bus ride from Palmer Square.

Parking:
Free street parking can be found on California Avenue and many of the smaller neighborhood streets near the park. If you're unsure about a particular spot, be sure to watch out for permit parking signs and enforced days/times.

Car share:
If you'd rather not drive, we highly recommend taking Uber or Lyft to our ceremony and reception. If it's your first time using a car share service, sign up via the following links and we'll both get free rides! Lyft or Uber.

Bicycle:
Take Chicago's excellent Divvy bike share system to one of the stations near the venue!

Car share:
Take Uber or Lyft to and from the reception.

Traveling to Chicago

We spent the bulk of our twenties living in and learning to love the great city of Chicago. Many of our family and friends live right down the road, but if you're joining us from out of town, we'd love to make a few suggestions for what to do and see while you're here.
Lodging
We've lined up a small block of rooms at Spring Hill Suites on the Northwest side. Reserve a room by August 17th to get your spot.
Reserve a room
If you'd rather soak up a little more local flavor, we highly recommend checking out AirBnB.
Chicago AirBnB

We're pulling together a fun list of places to see while you're in town, including our favorite food, drink, and sights throughout Chicago. Check back soon!

FAQ

What should I wear?

Dress your best, but make sure your shoes are comfortable enough to hit the dance floor.

What's on the menu?

We're serving tacos and appetizers from Big Star. Come thirsty, because we'll have lots to drink, including a bourbon cocktail and selection of beers and wines.

Who am I sitting with?

Anyone! We aren't assigning seats, but don't worry! There will be plenty of delicious tacos for everyone.
